 1910:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1911: 
 1912: get_window_size(Term) ->
 1913:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1914:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1915:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1916: 
 1917: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 1918:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 1919: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1920:     Opts = #{},
 1921:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1922:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1923:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1924:     end,
 1925:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1926:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1927:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1928:                 error ->
 1929:                     OrigContent
 1930:                 end,
 1931:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 1932:         {match,_} ->
 1933:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1934:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1935:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1936:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1937:             ct:fail(match);
 1938:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1939:             ok;
 1940:         _ ->
 1941:             timer:sleep(500),
 1942:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1943:     end.
 1944: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 1945:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 1946: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 1947:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 1948: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1949:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1950:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1951:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1952:               end,
 1953:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1954:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1955:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1956:                   error ->
 1957:                       OrigContent
 1958:               end,
 1959:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 1960:         {match,_} ->
 1961:             ok;
 1962:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1963:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1964:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1965:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1966:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1967:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 1968:         _ ->
 1969:             timer:sleep(500),
 1970:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1971:     end.
 1972: 
 1973: get_content(Term) ->
 1974:     get_content(Term, "").
 1975: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 1976:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 1977:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 1978:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 1979:             C;
 1980:         [C] ->
 1981:             C
 1982:     end.
 1983: 
 1984: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 1985: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1986:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1987: 	old ->
 1988:             test_exit_initial(old);
 1989:         new ->
 1990:             test_exit_initial(old),
 1991:             test_exit_initial(new)
 1992:     end,
 1993:     ok.
 1994: 
 1995: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 1996:     rtnode:run(
 1997:       [{putline, ""},
 1998:        {putline, "2."},
 1999:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 2000:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2001:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2002:        {putline, ""},
 2003:        {putline, "35."},
 2004:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 2005:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 2006: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 2007:     rtnode:run(
 2008:       [{putline, ""},
 2009:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2010:        {putline, "2."},
 2011:        {expect, "2"},
 2012:        {putline,"exit()."},
 2013:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2014:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2015:        {putline, "35."},
 2016:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 2017: 
 2018: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2019:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 2020:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 2021:         {error, Reason} ->
 2022:             {skip, Reason};
 2023:         Tempdir ->
 2024:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 2025:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 2026:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 2027:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 2028:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 2029:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 2030:             ok
 2031:     end.
 2032: 
 2033: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 2034: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 2035: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 2036: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 2037: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 2038: %% on the current line.
 2039: %%
 2040: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 2041: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 2042: %% newline to happen.
 2043: %%
 2044: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 2045: %% we should.
 2046: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2047:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2048:         new ->
 2049:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 2050:             rtnode:run(
 2051:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 2052:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 2053:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2054:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 2055:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2056:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 2057:               ],
 2058:               [],
 2059:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 2060:         _ ->
 2061:             ok
 2062:     end,
 2063:     ok.
 2064: 
 2065: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 2066: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 2067: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 2068: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 2069: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 2070: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 2071: %% commands.
 2072: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2073:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 2074:     rtnode:run(
 2075:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 2076:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 2077:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2078:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 2079:        {putline, "echo3."},
 2080:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 2081:        {putline, "echo4."},
 2082:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 2083:        {putline, "echo5."},
 2084:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 2085:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2086:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2087:     rtnode:run(
 2088:       [{sleep,100},
 2089:        {putline, ""},
 2090:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 2091:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2092:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2093:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 2094:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2095:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2096:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2097:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2098:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2099:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2100:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 2101:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 2102:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 2103:       ], [], [],
 2104:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 2105:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2106: 
 2107:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 2108:     rtnode:run(
 2109:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 2110:         {expect, "getline>"},
 2111:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 2112:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 2113:        ], [], [],
 2114:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 2115:     ok.
 2116: 
 2117: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 2118:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 2119:     rtnode:run(
 2120:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2121:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2122:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2123:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2124:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 2125:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 2126: 
 2127:     {ok, Logs} =
 2128:         rtnode:run(
 2129:           [{sleep,100},
 2130:            {putline, ""},
 2131:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 2132:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2133:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2134:            {expect, "echo"}
 2135:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 2136:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 2137: 
 2138:     rtnode:check_logs(
 2139:       "erlang.log.1",
 2140:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2141:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2142: 
 2143:     ok.
 2144: 
 2145: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2146:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2147:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2148:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2149:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2150:     try
 2151:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2152:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2153: 
 2154:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2155:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2156:             rtnode:run(
 2157:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2158:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2159:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2160: 
 2161:         ct:log("~p",[Logs1]),
 2162:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2163: 
 2164:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2165:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2166:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2167:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2168:             rtnode:run(
 2169:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2170:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2171:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2172: 
 2173:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2174: 
 2175:     after
 2176:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2177:     end,
 2178:     ok.
 2179: 
 2180: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2181:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2182: 
 2183:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2184:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2185: 
 2186:     {ok, Logs} =
 2187:         rtnode:run(
 2188:           [{putline, ""},
 2189:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2190:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2191:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2192:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2193: 
 2194:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2195:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2196:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2197:                       false,
 2198:                       Logs),
 2199:     ok.
 2200: 
 2201: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2202:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2203: 
 2204:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2205:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2206: 
 2207:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2208:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2209:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2210:     ok = file:close(D),
 2211: 
 2212:     {ok, Logs} =
 2213:         rtnode:run(
 2214:           [{putline, ""},
 2215:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2216:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2217:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2218:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2219: 
 2220:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2221:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2222:                       Logs),
 2223:     ok.
 2224: 
 2225: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2226:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2227: 
 2228:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2229:     rtnode:run(
 2230:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2231:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2232:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2233:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2234:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2235: 
 2236:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2237:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2238:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2239:     ok = file:close(D),
 2240: 
 2241:     {ok, Logs} =
 2242:         rtnode:run(
 2243:           [{putline, ""},
 2244:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2245:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2246:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2247:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2248:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2249: 
 2250:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2251:     ok.
 2252: 
 2253: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2254: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2255:     try
 2256:         rtnode:run(
 2257:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2258:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2259:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2260:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2261:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2262:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2263:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2264:     catch
 2265:         _:_ ->
 2266:             ok
 2267:     end.
 2268: 
 2269: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2270:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2271:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2272: 
 2273: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2274:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2275:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2276:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2277:     ].
 2278: 
 2279: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2280:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2281:     rtnode:run(
 2282:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2283:        %% {putline, ""},
 2284:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2285:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2286:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2287:        {putline, "echo."},
 2288:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2289:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2290:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2291:     ok.
 2292: 
 2293: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2294: 
 2295:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2296:     %% provider module.
 2297:     rtnode:run(
 2298:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2299:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2300:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2301:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2302: 
 2303:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2304:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2305:     rtnode:run(
 2306:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2307:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2308:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2309:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2310:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2311: 
 2312:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2313:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2314:     rtnode:run(
 2315:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2316:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2317:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2318:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2319:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2320: 
 2321:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2322:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2323:     rtnode:run(
 2324:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2325:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2326:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2327:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2328:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2329:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2330: 
 2331:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2332:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2333:     rtnode:run(
 2334:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2335:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2336:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2337:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2338:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2339:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2340: 
 2341:     ok.
 2342: 
 2343: load() ->
 2344:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2345:         {ok, crash} ->
 2346:             error(crash);
 2347:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2348:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2349:             ok;
 2350:         _ ->
 2351:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2352:     end.
 2353: 
 2354: add(_Line) ->
 2355:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2356:         {ok, crash} ->
 2357:             error(crash);
 2358:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2359:             %% Should return ok
 2360:             {error, badreturn};
 2361:         _ ->
 2362:             io:format("!", [])
 2363:     end.
 2364: 
 2365: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2366: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2367:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2368: 	old ->
 2369: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2370: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2371: 	new ->
 2372: 	    %% New shell tests
 2373: 	    rtnode:run(
 2374:               [{putline, ""},
 2375:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2376:                {putline, "2."},
 2377:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2378:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2379:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2380:                {putline, "s"},
 2381:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2382:                {putline, "c"},
 2383:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2384:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2385:                {putline, "35."},
 2386:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2387:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2388:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2389:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2390:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2391:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2392:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2393:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2394:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2395:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2396:                {putline, "c"},
 2397:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2398:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2399:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2400:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2401:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2402:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2403:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2404:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2405:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2406:                {putline, "k"},
 2407:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2408:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2409:                {putline, "c"},
 2410:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2411:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2412:                {putline, "i"},
 2413:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2414:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2415:                {putline, "?"},
 2416:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2417:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2418:                {putline, "h"},
 2419:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2420:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2421:                {putdata, "\t"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2422:                {sleep, 100},
 2423:                {putline, ""},
 2424:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2425:                {putdata, "\^r"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2426:                {sleep, 100},
 2427:                {putline, ""},
 2428:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2429:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2430:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2431:                {putline, "35."},
 2432:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2433:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2434:               ]),
 2435:             ok
 2436:     end.
 2437: 
 2438: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2439: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2440:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2441: 	old ->
 2442: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2443: 	_ ->
 2444:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2445:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2446:             try
 2447:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2448:             after
 2449:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2450:             end
 2451:     end.
 2452: 
 2453: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2454: %% -noshell node.
 2455: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2456:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2457: 	old ->
 2458: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2459: 	_ ->
 2460: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2461:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2462:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2463:             try
 2464:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2465:             after
 2466:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2467:             end
 2468:     end.
 2469: 
 2470: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2471:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2472:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2473:                                    receive die ->
 2474:                                            ok
 2475:                                    end
 2476:                            end),
 2477:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2478:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2479:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2480:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2481: 
 2482:     rtnode:run(
 2483:       [{putline, ""},
 2484:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2485:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2486:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2487:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2488:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2489:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2490:        {putline, "j"},
 2491:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2492:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2493:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2494:        {putline, "c"},
 2495:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2496:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2497:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2498:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2499:        {expect, PidStr},
 2500:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2501:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2502:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2503:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2504:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2505:        {putline, "j"},
 2506:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2507:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2508:        {putline, "c"},
 2509:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2510:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2511:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2512:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2513:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2514:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2515:        {putline, "j"},
 2516:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2517:        {putline, "c"},
 2518:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2519:        {sleep, 100},
 2520:        {putline, "35."},
 2521:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2522:       ], RemNode),
 2523:     Pid ! die,
 2524:     ok.
 2525: 
 2526: %% Tests various control keys.
 2527: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2528:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2529:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2530:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2531:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2532:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2533:     rtnode:run(
 2534:       [{putline,""},
 2535:        {putline,"2."},
 2536:        {expect,"2"},
 2537:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2538:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2539:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2540:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2541:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2542:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2543:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2544:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2545:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2546:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2547:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2548:     ok.
 2549: 
 2550: wordLeft() ->
 2551:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2552:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2553:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2554:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2555: 
 2556: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2557:     End = "\eOF",
 2558:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2559:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2560: 
 2561: wordRight() ->
 2562:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2563:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2564:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2565:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2566: 
 2567: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2568:     Home = "\eOH",
 2569:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2570:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2571: 
 2572: %% Test that -remsh works
 2573: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2574:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2575:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2576:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2577: 
 2578:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2579:                {putline,"node()."},
 2580:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2581: 
 2582:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2583: 
 2584:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2585:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2586:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2587:     rtnode:run(
 2588:       PreCmds ++
 2589:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2590:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2591:           PostCmds,
 2592:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2593: 
 2594:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2595:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2596: 
 2597:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2598:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2599:                [], " ",
 2600:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2601: 
 2602:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2603: 
 2604:     ok.
 2605: 
 2606: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2607: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2608:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2609:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2610: 
 2611: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2612:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2613:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2614:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2615:      {putline, "s"},
 2616:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2617:      {putline, "c"},
 2618:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2619:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2620: 
 2621: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2622: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2623:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2624:     Domain =
 2625:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2626:             [] ->
 2627:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2628:             _ -> ""
 2629:         end,
 2630:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2631:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2632:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2633:             try
 2634:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2635:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2636:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2637:                 try
 2638:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2639:                            SNode,
 2640:                            STPid,
 2641:                            [{putline, ""},
 2642:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2643:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2644:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2645:                            CNode,
 2646:                            CTPid,
 2647:                            [{putline, ""},
 2648:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2649:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2650:                 after
 2651:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2652:                 end
 2653:             after
 2654:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2655:             end;
 2656:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2657:             Else
 2658:     end.
 2659: 
 2660: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2661: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2662:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2663:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2664:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2665:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2666:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2667:             try
 2668:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2669:                        SNode,
 2670:                        STPid,
 2671:                        [{putline, ""},
 2672:                         {putline, "node()."},
 2673:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2674:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2675:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2676:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 2677:                 try
 2678:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2679:                            CNode,
 2680:                            CTPid,
 2681:                            [{putline, ""},
 2682:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2683:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2684:                 after
 2685:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2686:                 end
 2687:             after
 2688:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2689:             end;
 2690:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2691:             Else
 2692:     end.
 2693: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2694:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 2695:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 2696:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 2697:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 2698:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2699:             try
 2700:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2701:                        STPid,
 2702:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2703:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2704:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2705:             after
 2706:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2707:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2708:             end;
 2709:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2710:     end.
 2711: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2712:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2713:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 2714:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 2715:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 2716:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 2717:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 2718:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 2719:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2720:                     try
 2721:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2722:                             STPid,
 2723:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2724:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2725:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2726:                     after
 2727:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2728:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2729:                     end;
 2730:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2731:             end
 2732:     end.
 2733: 
 2734: printed_atom(A) ->
 2735:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
